entry.title: Oxford Houses: A Self-Supporting Path to Recovery in Douglas County
entry.summary: In Roseburg, a unique approach to addiction recovery is making a significant impact through Oxford Houses - democratic, self-run homes where individuals in recovery support each other in maintaining sobriety. entry.title: Tragic Logging Accident Claims Life Near Azalea
entry.summary: Justin Godel, a 49-year-old Winston resident, lost his life Thursday afternoon in a logging accident. The incident occurred while Godel was working for Dancer Logging at a site on Upper Cow Creek Road near Azalea, Oregon. Emergency services were alerted to the serious injury at approximately 3:20 p.m.

entry.title: Debunking Myths about Short-Term Rentals on the Oregon Coast
entry.summary: Short-Term Rentals (STRs) are a vital part of the Oregon Coast tourism landscape. Like the Transient Lodging Tax, they are subject to a lot of misinformation. As the Regional Destination Management Organization for the Oregon Coast, we’re invested in making sure that our communities are healthy and sustainable long term– both for visitors and for… The post Debunking Myths about Short-Term Rentals on the Oregon Coast appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Tribes, 34 organizations, receive $23 million to support home repairs
entry.summary: OHA’s Healthy Homes Grant Program seeks improved housing conditions, health outcomes for low-income residents to prevent displacement PORTLAND, Ore.— Oregon Health Authority (OHA) has awarded $23 million to repair and rehabilitate homes of low-income residents to eliminate risks to residents’ health to the Nine Federally Recognized Tribes of Oregon and 34 local organizations. The funds… The post Tribes, 34 organizations, receive $23 million to support home repairs appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Demolition underway at SOU’s Cascade Complex
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — Southern Oregon University’s Cascade Complex, an obsolete cluster of nine residence halls and a cafeteria that have been largely unused since 2013, is being demolished over the next three months to make room for the anticipated development of a senior living center on the five-acre site at the southwest corner of campus.… The post Demolition underway at SOU’s Cascade Complex appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
